body.p: To His Excellency B. Magoffin Govenor of the State of Kentucky,

Your petitioners Eliza Moore F. B. Everslain, W. T. Cooke, M. B. Pulliam, Samuel Ruply and James Burke, citizens of Mercer County, very respectfully represent to your Excellency, that a Judgment has been entered against them in the Washington circuit Court in the sum of $400 on a forfeited recognizance of W. H. Moore & $6,50cts. costs in March 1862, and upon which a capais has issued and is now in the hands of the sheriff of Mercer County --

They state that the said W. H. Moore was a youth, & the son of the Petitioner, Eliza Moore, and was charged with larceny, and that your petitioners became bail for his appearance at the request of and in conjunction with his ^sd^ mother, she havig indemified the other of your petitioners by all she owns or possesses & which is not more than sufficent to pay the said Judgment, & that if executed by the commonwealth will take it all from her & leave her pennyless -- she is a woman of age & has no other property & has no one to take care of her & is dependant upon the little property on which the other of your petitioners hold said lein for a partial support -- The boy, her
said son W. H. Moore was young and inexperienced, and believed to be innocent and in fright left his home & his mother and has gone to the wars, -- she is in a helpless condition, and will be the whole sufferer, if not relieved by Executive clemency, -- she will be compelled to pay the Commonwealths attrnys fees, & the cost which is more than she can pay without suffering to her, wherefore we ask that your Excellency will remit said Judgment, and give her relief which the circumstances, & her condition implore --

Eliza Moore
W. T. Cooke
Saml Ruply
Jas Burke
M. B. Pulliam
B. F. Everslain
This day came before me Eliza Moore & M. B. Pulliam and made oath that they believe the statements of the forgoing Petition are true
Giving now my hand this 1 day of October 1861. --
John Slavens Jr J. P. C. H.

-- The undersigned citizens of Mercer County respectfully requests the Hon B. Magoffin Govener of Ky to remit the fine referred to in the forgoing Petition & unite in the prayer thereof -- Oct 1 -- 1861

W. A. Hooe
John Slavens Jr
Chr Chinn
Tho Allin
N H Burrus
Ben C Allin
Wm B Allin
B W Allin
F. W. Currey
Thos H Buckner
R N Scott
A. F. Cochran
S W Jones
John Kane Jr
Wm C Clark
John Kane
A, Portwood
Return Remittance to W. A. Hooe if remitted --

Washington Cir Ct
Remitted
B. M.

$400 } Recog
Eliza Moore & otherz
Iss Oct 10 1861
